result.title: Problem 1A: Theatre Square
result.content:
Theatre Square in the capital city of Berland has a rectangular shape with the size n × m meters. On the occasion of the city's anniversary, a decision was taken to pave the Square with square granite flagstones. Each flagstone is of the size a × a.

What is the least number of flagstones needed to pave the Square? It's allowed to cover the surface larger than the Theatre Square, but the Square has to be covered. It's not allowed to break the flagstones. The sides of flagstones should be parallel to the sides of the Square.

Input The input contains three positive integer numbers in the first line: n,  m and a (1 ≤  n, m, a ≤ 109).

Output Write the needed number of flagstones.

Sample test(s) input 6 6 4 output 4

Approach:: Say n = columns, m = rows

Now we have to fill up the rows by tiles (width=a)
Number of tiles (totally inside row) = m/a
of tiles (to cover up the extra remaining space in row, if any {m%a>0} ) = 1
Therefore,
Number of tiles inside one row = (m/a) [ if m%a==0 ]
Number of tiles inside one row = (m/a) + 1 [ if m%a>0 ]

Now we have to fill up the columns by tiles (width=a)
Number of tiles (totally inside col) = n/a
Number of tiles (to cover up the extra remaining space in row, if any {n%a>0} ) = 1
Therefore,
Number of tiles inside one row = (n/a) [ if n%a==0 ]
Number of tiles inside one row = (n/a) + 1 [ if n%a>0 ]

Hence total Number tiles required = ( Number of tiles inside one row) * ( Number of tiles inside one column)

1. Total Number tiles required = (m/a) * (n/a) [ If m%a==0 && n%a==0 ]
2. Total Number tiles required = (m/a + 1) * (n/a) [ If m%a>0 && n%a==0 ]
3. Total Number tiles required = (m/a) * (n/a + 1) [ If m%a==0 && n%a>0 ]
4. Total Number tiles required = (m/a + 1) * (n/a + 1) [ If m%a>0 && n%a>0 ]
